references.paper_title: Scaling rectified flow transformers for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduces FLUX, a state-of-the-art diffusion transformer model used as a baseline for the proposed CLEAR method in the current research.
This foundational paper introduces the attention mechanism, which is central to diffusion transformers and the focus of the efficiency improvements in CLEAR.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is a crucial component for evaluating the quality of image generation models, and is used extensively in the experimental results section.

references.paper_title: Gans trained by a two time-scale update rule converge to a local nash equilibrium
references.reason: The Frchet Inception Distance (FID) score, introduced in this paper, is a key metric for evaluating the quality of generated images, used to compare the performance of the original and the optimized model.

references.paper_title: The unreasonable effectiveness of deep features as a perceptual metric
references.reason: The Learned Perceptual Image Patch Similarity (LPIPS) metric, presented in this paper, is another crucial evaluation metric for assessing the visual quality of generated images, used alongside FID.
